stem: The nursing team is transferring a client from a bed to a stretcher using a slider board. Place the steps in the correct order.

options.text: On a count of three, pull the slider board and the client onto the stretcher as a unit.
Adjust the bed height until it is slightly higher than the stretcher.
Lock the wheels on both the bed and the stretcher.
Log-roll the client and place the slider board half-way underneath them.
Remove the slider board and ensure the stretcher side rails are raised.

rationale.correct: Safe patient handling prevents injury to the client and the staff. (1) Locking wheels is the #1 safety step. (2) Higher-to-lower transfer uses gravity to help. (3) Board placement provides a friction-free bridge. (4) Coordination prevents strain. (5) Finalizing safely.
rationale.incorrect: Attempting to pull the client across a gap without locking the wheels is a major fall risk.
clinicalPearls: Transferring a client requires at least three staff members: one on the pulling side, one on the pushing side, and one to stabilize the head/neck if necessary.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember 'High to Low'. The bed should be slightly HIGHER than the stretcher when moving TO the stretcher.

reviewUnits.heading: Safe Patient Handling and Mobility (SPHM)
reviewUnits.body: Nurses use proper body mechanics: wide base of support, keep the load close to the body, and lift with the legs, not the back.
